dItem.boxText: <font size="17">Calvinism had much in common with Lutheranism.</font>
<font size="17">Calvin believed that people essentially had control over their own salvation.</font>
<font size="17">Calvin believed that one’s behavior on earth reflected whether or not that person had been “saved.”</font>
<font size="17">Calvinists adopted a strict moral code that prohibited such activities as dancing.</font>
<font size="17">Calvinists in Geneva were relatively lax in carrying out punishments.</font>
<font size="17">Calvinists believed they were on a mission to reform the world.</font>
